medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Developed upper abdominal pain 2 weeks ago after drinking coffee, which initially improved with TUMS. Pain returned at about 11 am before admission and was accompanied by vomiting at 2:15. No diarrhea, nausea, or constipation reported. The patient has been eating regularly and has been trying to cut down on coffee consumption.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous history of alcohol abuse but has not consumed alcohol regularly since [unknown date]. COPD, Hyperlipidemia, Hypertension, Coronary artery disease with myocardial infarction and CABG, Previous prostate surgery, Remote history of peptic ulcer disease, Tonsillectomy as a child.
